title: Conditional expressions: using 'a if cond else b' responsibly
content:
Python supports a compact conditional expression:

`value_if_true if condition else value_if_false`

This is often called a “ternary expression.” It can make code shorter, but it should still remain readable.

---
## 1) Basic usage

```python
x = 7
label = "even" if x % 2 == 0 else "odd"
print(label)
```

---
## 2) Prefer it for simple expressions
A short conditional expression is great for small decisions.

```python
name = ""
display = name if name else "(anonymous)"
print(display)
```

For more complex logic, a standard if/elif/else block is easier to maintain.

---
## 3) Using conditional expressions inside formatting

```python
score = 82
status = "pass" if score >= 75 else "fail"
print(f"score={score} status={status}")
```

---
## 4) A compact mapping pattern
Sometimes you can replace a short if/else with a mapping, but the conditional expression is still helpful for quick cases.

```python
n = -3
sign = "pos" if n > 0 else ("zero" if n == 0 else "neg")
print(sign)
```

---
## 5) Practice block: sanitize a value

```python
raw = "  42 "
clean = raw.strip()
value = int(clean) if clean.isdigit() else None
print(value)
```
